greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of iterations of n -> n + (number of 1's in binary representation of n) needed for the trajectory of n to join the trajectory of A010062.
comment: Conjecture: For any positive integer starting value n, iterations of n -> n + (number of 1's in binary representation of n) will eventually join A010062.
link: Rémy Sigrist, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Index entries for Colombian or self numbers and related sequences
example: a(6)=4 because the trajectory for 1 (sequence A010062) starts
so the sequence beginning with 6 joins A010062 after 4 steps.
program: (PARI) a(n) = { my (o=1); for (k=0, oo, while (o<n, o=o+hammingweight(o)); if (o==n, return (k), n=n+hammingweight(n))) } \\ _Rémy Sigrist_, Apr 05 2020
results.author: _Jason Earls_, Jun 25 2004
